description: After weighing the risks, Rada Miskovic decides not to support the Council's recalibration plan. Instead, she compiles hidden evidence and drafts a call for citizen juries to investigate the BCI and Council actions publicly.

Rada goes live on multiple platforms, exposing leaks about BCI abuses and Council cover-ups, and urges neighborhoods to organize citizen juries for open investigations. Public debate erupts almost immediately.
Multiple neighborhoods organize the first citizen juries, livestreaming reviews of local BCI records and Council decisions. Calls for accountability spread citywide.

The inaugural jury publicly questions a former Council official over service denials, BCI failures, and Halden's death. Contradictory testimonies and new document leaks further intensify citizen protests.

Council factions, attempting to sway outcomes, release older secrets that expose deeper system abuses. While people feel empowered by the jury process, divisions and distrust grow as citizens confront the full scale of BCI manipulation.
